meanings.definition: To treat with contempt or scorn.
meanings.sent1: She was distaining his ideas, making him feel small.
meanings.sent2: The bully was distaining the new student in front of everyone.
meanings.sent3: The cat was distaining the toy mouse, thinking it was beneath her.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes distaining his presence as if he were invisible.
meanings.sent5: The queen was distaining the commoners with a single glance.

meanings.definition: To reject or refuse with disdain.
meanings.sent1: He distained the offer, believing it was not worth his time.
meanings.sent2: She distained the apology, feeling it was insincere.
meanings.sent3: The child distained the vegetables on his plate, pushing them away.
meanings.sent4: The artist distained the traditional methods, opting for a more modern approach.
meanings.sent5: The knight distained the surrender, choosing to fight until the end.
